TopicTitle: Would it be possible to re-make Alternis Kerbol with Kopernicus?

Articles.Content:
I'm a fan of the [Alternis Kerbol](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/63536-0-23-Alternis-Kerbol-Release-thread-v0-1-Jan-3-%28development-halted%29) mod, thus it was a big shame when NovaSilisko announced the short end of its development. However, I'd like to continue the development of the mod - even though it'd probably miss a few features, such as Gilly and Ike's comet trails - and since license is not a problem, that only leaves me with two problems(and my near-inexistent coding skills):

**Can Kopernicus let you change existing planetary bodies? And would it still accept the existing planetary maps for Alternis Kerbol?**
I think the mod you're looking for is [Real Solar System](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/55145). It makes it pretty easy to edit planet parameters using a cfg file.

I believe so. It's complicated, but I think some people have done it. You should go ask this on the Kopernicus thread [here](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/114649-0-90-Kopernicus-Pre-Alpha-%280-0-6%29).

EDIT: Ninja'd!

Not quite Alternis Kerbol, but the same idea (and it works in 1.0 unlike the others at this point):

[New Horizons](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/114092)

> 
> I think the mod you're looking for is [Real Solar System](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/55145). It makes it pretty easy to edit planet parameters using a cfg file.

Hm, interesting. I will take a look.
And since RSS is going to use Kopernicus to do the planets editing ....
